body.p:
Hodgenville Ky. Oct 4 1860
His Excellency
Gov. Magoffin
Dear Sir

Their is a vacancy now in this the 1st the Justices district of Magistrate ^for Larue Cont^ occasioned by the resignation of Lewis Read Esq, and the citizens of this town and district ^desire^ that one be appointed who lives in the town of Hodgenville and in looking round for the purpose of ascertaining who would best suit the people and give general Satisfaction, we have come to the conclusion that our townsman George W Brownfield is the man, and we therefore solicit his appointment Mr. Brownfield is and always has been a good and constant Democrat and is well calculated to fill the office, his appointment will confer a lasting favor on your friends

W B Read
W H Hamilton
A M Jones
H S Johnson
J.F. Cessna P. J L C
William Robertson

Larue Co.
J P.
G. W. Brownfield
vice
Lewis Read
comd. Nov. 8. 1860
